title: Workshop on Applying Assessment Strategies in Qualitative Research-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic instructional design theories and social research methodologies
context.additional_context: Course focused on strengthening assessment design competencies for project-based evaluation, targeting graduate social science majors

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain three or more types of informal assessment tools (e.g., formative feedback) in the instructional design process
Learners can design two or more methods for collecting assessment data using mobile devices in resource-constrained technical environments
Learners can develop evaluation systems applying qualitative research techniques (e.g., participant observation, in-depth interviews) in project-based assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
